title: Cloud Concepts & Architecture
description: Learn AWS Cloud fundamentals, benefits, and architectural principles

questions.question: What is the AWS Well-Architected Framework's primary purpose?
options: To provide guidance on building secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure
questions.explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Framework helps cloud architects build secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure.

questions.question: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The six pillars are: Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, Cost Optimization, and Sustainability.

questions.question: What does "elasticity" mean in cloud computing?
options: The ability to stretch physical hardware
The ability to automatically scale resources up or down based on demand
questions.explanation: Elasticity is the ability to acquire resources as you need them and release them when you no longer need them, scaling automatically with demand.

questions.question: What is the difference between vertical and horizontal scaling?
options: Vertical adds more instances, horizontal adds more power to existing instances
Vertical adds more power to existing instances, horizontal adds more instances
Vertical is for databases only, horizontal is for web servers only
questions.explanation: Vertical scaling (scale up) means adding more power (CPU, RAM) to existing instances. Horizontal scaling (scale out) means adding more instances.

questions.question: Which AWS service would you use to distribute incoming application traffic across multiple targets?
questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancer automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as EC2 instances.

questions.question: What is the AWS Shared Responsibility Model?
options: AWS is responsible for security OF the cloud, customers are responsible for security IN the cloud
AWS and customers share all responsibilities equally
questions.explanation: AWS manages security OF the cloud (infrastructure), while customers manage security IN the cloud (data, applications, configurations).

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of cloud computing?
options: Trade capital expense for variable expense
Increased need for data center maintenance
questions.explanation: Cloud computing allows you to trade capital expense (upfront costs) for variable expense (pay only for what you use).

questions.question: What does "high availability" mean in AWS?
options: Resources are available only during business hours
Systems are designed to operate continuously without failure for a long time
questions.explanation: High availability means designing systems to operate continuously without failure for a designated period, often using multiple Availability Zones.

questions.question: What is an AWS Region?
options: A geographic area that contains multiple Availability Zones
questions.explanation: An AWS Region is a geographic area that contains multiple physically separated Availability Zones, providing fault tolerance and stability.

questions.question: What is an AWS Availability Zone?
options: One or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity
questions.explanation: An Availability Zone consists of one or more discrete data centers, each with redundant power, networking, and connectivity, housed in separate facilities.

questions.question: Which deployment model is best for maintaining legacy systems while adopting cloud services?
questions.explanation: Hybrid deployment connects on-premises infrastructure with cloud resources, ideal for maintaining legacy systems while adopting cloud services.

questions.question: What is the principle of "loose coupling" in cloud architecture?
options: Components are designed to have minimal dependencies on each other
Components must all be in the same Region
questions.explanation: Loose coupling means designing components with minimal dependencies, so changes or failures in one component don't cascade to others.

questions.question: How many Availability Zones are typically in an AWS Region?
questions.explanation: AWS Regions typically have at least 3 Availability Zones, but some have more to provide redundancy and fault tolerance.

questions.question: What advantage of cloud computing allows you to deploy applications in multiple locations worldwide?
options: Trade capital expense for variable expense
questions.explanation: Cloud computing enables you to deploy applications in multiple AWS Regions around the world with just a few clicks, reducing latency for global users.

questions.question: In the context of AWS, what does "scaling out" refer to?
options: Increasing the size of existing instances
Adding more instances to handle increased load
questions.explanation: Scaling out (horizontal scaling) means adding more instances to distribute the workload, rather than making existing instances larger.

questions.question: Which pillar of the Well-Architected Framework focuses on environmental impact?
questions.explanation: The Sustainability pillar focuses on minimizing the environmental impacts of running cloud workloads.

questions.question: What type of cloud model delivers applications over the internet that are managed by a third party?
questions.explanation: SaaS delivers fully managed applications over the internet, like Gmail, Salesforce, or Office 365.

questions.question: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, who is responsible for patching the guest operating system?
options: Customer for IaaS services like EC2
questions.explanation: For IaaS services like EC2, customers are responsible for patching the guest OS. For managed services, AWS handles this.

questions.question: Which statement best describes cloud computing?
options: On-demand delivery of IT resources via the internet with pay-as-you-go pricing
Storing all data on local hard drives
questions.explanation: Cloud computing is the on-demand delivery of compute power, database, storage, and other IT resources through the internet with pay-as-you-go pricing.

questions.question: What does fault tolerance mean in AWS architecture?
options: The system can continue operating despite component failures
The system is immune to attacks
questions.explanation: Fault tolerance means the system can continue to operate properly even when some of its components fail, often through redundancy.

documentation:
Cloud Concepts & Architecture

What is Cloud Computing?

Cloud computing is the on-demand delivery of IT resources over the Internet with pay-as-you-go pricing. Instead of buying, owning, and maintaining physical data centers and servers, you can access technology services on an as-needed basis.

Six Advantages of Cloud Computing:

  1. Trade capital expense for variable expense: Pay only for what you consume instead of investing in data centers upfront
  2. Benefit from massive economies of scale: Lower variable costs due to AWS's scale
  3. Stop guessing capacity: Scale up or down based on actual needs
  4. Increase speed and agility: Reduce time to make resources available from weeks to minutes
  5. Stop spending money on data center operations: Focus on customers rather than infrastructure
  6. Go global in minutes: Deploy applications worldwide quickly

Types of Cloud Computing:

  • Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS): Basic building blocks - compute, storage, networking (EC2, S3)
  • Platform as a Service (PaaS): Remove need to manage infrastructure (Elastic Beanstalk, RDS)
  • Software as a Service (SaaS): Completed product managed by service provider (Gmail, Office 365)

Cloud Deployment Models:

  • Cloud: Everything runs in the cloud (startups, new applications)
  • Hybrid: Connects cloud resources with on-premises infrastructure (banks, legacy systems)
  • On-Premises (Private Cloud): Resources deployed on-premises using virtualization

AWS Global Infrastructure:

  • Regions: Geographic areas containing multiple Availability Zones (e.g., us-east-1, eu-west-1)
  • Availability Zones (AZs): One or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity
  • Edge Locations: Used by CloudFront for content delivery (caching)

AWS Well-Architected Framework - Six Pillars:

  1. Operational Excellence: Run and monitor systems to deliver business value
  2. Security: Protect information, systems, and assets
  3. Reliability: Recover from failures and meet demand
  4. Performance Efficiency: Use resources efficiently
  5. Cost Optimization: Avoid unnecessary costs
  6. Sustainability: Minimize environmental impact

Key Architectural Concepts:

  • Scalability: Ability to handle growth (vertical = more power, horizontal = more instances)
  • Elasticity: Automatically scale resources based on demand
  • High Availability: Systems operate continuously without failure
  • Fault Tolerance: System continues to operate despite component failures
  • Loose Coupling: Components have minimal dependencies on each other

AWS Shared Responsibility Model:

AWS Responsibility (Security OF the Cloud):

  • Physical infrastructure (data centers, hardware)
  • Network infrastructure
  • Hypervisor and virtualization layer

Customer Responsibility (Security IN the Cloud):

  • Customer data
  • Platform, applications, Identity & Access Management
  • Operating system, network, and firewall configuration
  • Encryption (data at rest and in transit)
